Package: gov.noaa.messageapi.interfaces

[Java] Interface IEndpoint

  • An IEndpoint is a user written class that is the terminating point of a given process. Endpoints generally extend an AbstractEndpoint method, expose as much possible behavior as configurable parameters in the constructor, and provide a list of fields that will be used in creation of a new 'EndpointRecord'. When a Request is submitted, the Response will eventually pass records into Endpoints, and call the Endpoint 'process' method. Endpoints have access to lists of records defined in any container that was specified in the Session Manifest as being part of a particular Endpoint connection. These records can be retrieved within the 'process' method by making appropriate calls on the passed ProtocolRecord. The process method returns an IPacket, which contains a list of IRecords and/or IRejections, which will all eventually be recombined inside the calling IResponse.

    Authors:
    Ryan Berkheimer

    • Methods Summary

        Methods 
        Type Params Return Type Name and description
        IPacket createPacket()
        Creates a new packet for returning from the endpoint.
        IRecord createRecord()
        Creates a new Endpoint Record that can be used as a record for the returned IPacket of the process method.
        IRejection createRejection(IRecord record, java.lang.String reason)
        Creates a new Endpoint Rejection that can be used as a rejection for the returned IPacket of the process method.

        IPacket process(IProtocolRecord record)
        Process is the main method of an Endpoint.

    • Method Detail

      • public IPacket createPacket()

        Creates a new packet for returning from the endpoint. As all processing for endpoints must return a packet, all endpoints must also implement a packet creation mechanism. Only the empty packet initializer is required.

        Returns:

      • public IRecord createRecord()

        Creates a new Endpoint Record that can be used as a record for the returned IPacket of the process method. This construct helps users to understand what type of records will be returned by the Endpoint.

      • public IRejection createRejection(IRecord record, java.lang.String reason)

        Creates a new Endpoint Rejection that can be used as a rejection for the returned IPacket of the process method. This construct helps users to understand what type of rejectiosn will be returned by the Endpoint.

      • public java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object> getConstructor()

        Returns the constructor map attached to the endpoint. The constructor map should be used to retrieve constructor parameters. Note that thread safety cannot be guaranteed if these parameters are used as read only.

      • public java.util.List<IField> getDefaultFields()

        Returns a list of fields used in the createRecord method of the Endpoint. These fields may be used to define the records that are returned to the caller in the IPacket.

      • public IPacket process(IProtocolRecord record)

        Process is the main method of an Endpoint. It is the method that is called when an Endpoint is executed as part of a process. Within a process method, the endpoint has complete access to any record lists that were defined outside of code as part of the Endpoint Connection specification in the Session manifest. The process method must return an IPacket which contains IRecords and/or IRejections to return to the caller.
